data.text: @Lizstuartdc @abuttenheim e.g. I think adding some visual signifier of population density might make it more interpretable but I'm not entirely sure...

@Lizstuartdc @abuttenheim This is something that drives me crazy about some of the county covid maps - curious, do you have examples/suggestions for ways to better scale for small county-level populations in these types of maps? Something I'm interested in...  https://t.co/uptnKXifq1
@abuttenheim Likely test coverage limits and underreporting in urban areas.
@abuttenheim That Vermont journalists need to dig deeper into what the hell is happening in Bennington county which has been the highest per capita for awhile now. Just so damn high.
@abuttenheim Noisy rates in counties with small populations. (Although I have also noticed that Maine overall has had a slow steady increase during omicron).
@abuttenheim I literally thought that's a map of opioid death in the US when it first pops up.
